summary: SkyBurial ENB creates original atmosphere and completely suitable for comfortable perception of gameplay. Mod is fully focused on immersion in the gameplay.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://grteam.ucoz.net/nexus/skyburial/logo/0_logo.jpg[/img][/center]
[img]http://grteam.ucoz.net/nexus/skyburial/design/1_overview.png[/img]
[center][b][color=#7d7d7d]SkyBurial[/color] ENB[/b] was originally developed by the author for his own use.
This mod - is subjective preferences of author.
[b][color=#7d7d7d]SkyBurial[/color] ENB[/b] creates original atmosphere and completely suitable for comfortable perception of gameplay.[/center]
[center][img]http://grteam.ucoz.net/nexus/skyburial/images/1_atmospheric_gameplay.jpg[/img][/center]
[center][b][color=#7d7d7d]SkyBurial[/color] ENB[/b] designed especially for Climates of Tamriel.
Don\'t use [b][color=#7d7d7d]SkyBurial[/color] ENB[/b] without Climates of Tamriel![/center]
[center][img]http://grteam.ucoz.net/nexus/skyburial/images/4_special_for_cot.jpg[/img][/center]
Configuration uses a library of enbseries version 0.113, because:
[b]1.[/b] It\'s quite productive (compared to previous versions), and it has all the necessary options.
[b]2.[/b] Many other popular ENB also used (and some still use) this version.
[b]3.[/b] In this version section [SKY] works correctly and looks better.

Features of [b][color=#7d7d7d]SkyBurial[/color] ENB[/b]: 
[i] - Original color palette. 
 - Fixed overexposed vanilla bloom.   
 - No overexposed bright and middle tones.
 - No oversaturated colors. 
 - Balanced dark nights/interiors/dungeons. 
 - Soft and overexposed lights. 
 - Beauty day time and night time sky.[/i]

[center][img]http://grteam.ucoz.net/nexus/skyburial/images/2_balanced_ambient.jpg[/img]
[img]http://grteam.ucoz.net/nexus/skyburial/images/3_immersive_lights.jpg[/img][/center]
[color=green]Q:[/color] Why 0.113?
[color=green]A:[/color] Because [b][color=#7d7d7d]SkyBurial[/color] ENB[/b] was originally developed by the author for his own use. I don\'t like to play without AA and 0.113 looks better in my opinion.

[color=green]Q:[/color] So why not 0.119? It\'s same, with AA and have other options.
[color=green]A:[/color] Because 0.119 have wrong SKY detect colors.

[b][color=#7d7d7d]SkyBurial[/color] ENB[/b] v.2.2 changelog:

[i]- Rework configuration for newest versions of enbseries (still beta, only for testing);
- Fixed NIGHTDAY option; 
- Fixed BlueShift option;
- Fixed SubSurfaceScattering option;
- Fixed PointLighting option:
- Some minor fixes;
- File effect.txt now is optional (read Blur Sharp Shift.txt);
- Added optional Letterbox;
- Added optional Depth of Field;[/i]
[img]http://grteam.ucoz.net/nexus/skyburial/design/2_information.png[/img]
[b]My spec\'s:[/b] 
[i] - ASUS P5E; 
 - DualCore Intel Core 2 Duo E6750, 2.666 MHz; 
 - 6.0 GB RAM; 
 - NVIDIA GeForce GTX 550 Ti (306.97 WHQL); 
 - Microsoft Windows 7 Enterprise (x64); 
 - Resolution: 1440?900 (16:10 - 19 inch);[/i]
[b]Game version:[/b] [color=green]1.8[/color].

[i]Stable 30-35 FPS, sometimes drop to 25 FPS (in Falkreath, for example)[/i].
[img]http://grteam.ucoz.net/nexus/skyburial/design/3_installation.png[/img]
Archive contains two versions of the mod:
- [b]Final Version (Main Version)[/b] - main version of the mod (recommended);
- [b]Beta Version[/b] - beta version of the mod (only for testing);

[b]1.[/b] Download 0.113[color=green]*[/color] ENB dll file (or 0.131 for beta version) and put it to the main Skyrim directory: 
[color=green][i]\\Bethesda Softworks\\Skyrim\\[/i][/color]
[url=http://www.enbdev.com/download_mod_tesskyrim.htm]ENB v.0.113[/url]
[color=green]*[/color]Install only wrapper version.

[b]2[/b]. Copy all files from mod directory:
[color=green][i]\\1 - Final Version (Main Version)\\0.113 (with hardware AA)\\[/i][/color]
And put them to the main Skyrim directory:
[color=green][i]\\Bethesda Softworks\\Skyrim\\[/i][/color]

[b]3.[/b] Download and install [b]Climates of Tamriel v.2.1 Final[/b][color=green]*[/color].

[b]4.[/b] Install [b]ClimatesOfTamriel-VanillaNights-Lvl-3.esp[/b].

[color=green]*[/color]Don\'t install any .esp files from [color=green][i]\\01 Dungeons\\[/color] and [color=green]\\02 Interiors\\[/color] directories![/i]

[b]5.[/b] Check your SkyrimPrefs.ini:

[i]iBlurDeferredShadowMask=1
fGamma=1.0000
bFloatPointRenderTarget=1[/i]
[img]http://grteam.ucoz.net/nexus/skyburial/design/4_tweaks.png[/img]
Recommended drivers version for NVIDIA users: [color=green]306.97 WHQL[/color] (310.70 corrupt any ENB).
Recommended version of [b][color=#7d7d7d]SkyBurial[/color] ENB[/b] - [color=green]Final Version (Main Version)[/color].

If you want better performance - turn off any hardware AA or downscale your resolution.
Turning on FPS Limiter may solve problem with stuttering (enable by default). 

[i][color=green][LIMITER] 
WaitBusyRenderer=false 
EnableFPSLimit=true 
FPSLimit=40.0[/color][/i]
[img]http://grteam.ucoz.net/nexus/skyburial/design/5_mods.png[/img]
[b]Recommended mods:[/b]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/141]Skyrim Flora Overhaul[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/13268]WATER - Water And Terrain Enhancement Redux[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28110]Expanded Snow Systems - Climates of Tamriel Version[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/17609]Relighting Skyrim[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/9571]Remove Ambient Interior Fog[/url] (highly recommended)
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/85]Enhanced Night Skyrim[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/1188]More Subtle Nirnroot [/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3520]Paper Pack[/url] (or some similar)
[img]http://grteam.ucoz.net/nexus/skyburial/design/6_credits.png[/img]
[b]Thanks to:[/b]
[url=http://www.enbdev.com/]Boris Vorontsov[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/]Skyrim Nexus[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/17802]Project Reality - Climates Of Tamriel - Weather - Lighting[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/23364]SweetFX[/url]
author: Sadeness
